data.scheme_name: Scheme for Promotion of Research and Innovation in Pharma MedTech (PRIP) Sector-Existing
data.benefits: Funding up to Rs 100 lakhs would be provided to research projects in any of the six priority areas
data.eligibility:
1. SMEs, MSMEs, and Start-up with industry academia collaboration.
Previous collaboration (National / International)
Industrial collaboration
Academic collaboration
Developing new products/Technology through in Make in India, Startup India, and others
2. Availability of research talent and infrastructure
3. Unmet needs are being solved, disease being targeted, and national health concerns
4. Track records of patent/ citation/ research papers
5. Possibility of generating new IP 
6. Does the technology offer import substitution/ and offer export potential
data.conditions:
1. SMEs, MSMEs, and start-ups registered with DPIIT
2. Potential for Employment Generation
data.beneficiaries:
1. SMEs, MSMEs, and Start-up with industry academia collaboration.
Previous collaboration (National / International)
Industrial collaboration
Academic collaboration
Developing new products/Technology through in Make in India, Startup India, and others
2. Availability of research talent and infrastructure
3. Unmet needs are being solved, disease being targeted, and national health concerns
4. Track records of patent/ citation/ research papers
5. Possibility of generating new IP 
6. Does the technology offer import substitution/ and offer export potential
data.prerequisites:
1. SMEs, MSMEs, and start-ups registered with DPIIT
2. Potential for Employment Generation
data.context: This Scheme is started by Ministry of Chemicals & Fertilizers, launched in 17th August 2023, for Promotion of Research and Innovation in Pharma MedTech (PRIP) Sector
data.objective: To encourage industry to invest in R&D in ‘Priority areas’ and to inculcate the culture of quality research and nurture the pool of scientists in the country by promoting industry-academia linkage, which will lead to sustained global competitive advantage and contribute to quality employment generation in the country.
data.description: Funding up to Rs 100 lakhs would be provided to research projects in any of the six priority areas to help innovators including Indian startups and MSMEs to reach TRL 4. Around 125 research projects from innovators/ start-ups/ SMEs/ MSMEs having potential or having made sufficient headway in the research of priority areas will be selected.
data.how_to_apply:
The eligible entity shall apply through Online Portal Link-   to be given by PMA
Application format- https://pharmaceuticals.gov.in/sites/default/files/Approved%20Operational%20Guidelines%20%20%28PRIP%29.pdf  
Page- 43-45
data.funding_mechanism:
1 Project cost to be approved for R&D will be calculated post application acceptance. 
2 The funding allocated for various categories would be Rs. 125 crores 
3 The funding allocation is milestone based will be released in the following instalments: 
1st Instalment: Signing of Agreement 10% 
2nd Instalment: Completion of 1st Milestone 30% 
3rd Instalment: Completion of 2nd Milestone 30% 
4th Instalment: Completion of approved project and submission of final report 30% 
Total 100%. Milestone achievement reviewer is PMA. Last instalment will be released after submission of project completion report. 
4 The funding allocated for one category, if left under-utilized at the end of the year can be moved to other category applicants based on their need and performance. 
5 For the proposals finally approved for funding support, PMA will sign agreement with grantees on behalf of DoP. 
6 Necessary guidance notes and templates are provided to Grantees by PMA. 
7 All grantees are required to open a separate, auditable, no-lien bank account with a scheduled commercial bank in order to receive the funds. 
Budget planning is Upgradation of Equipment/ infrastructure- 70% of Nonrecurring cost & 
For Manpower, Consumables, Approvals, Clinical Trials, Travel, Contingencies etc., 30% of Recurring cost &
Waivers The above guidelines shall be followed unless there is a specific exemption by DoP.
data.additional_info:
Benefit Sharing;
1 Beneficiaries under category B III will need to share the benefits for the successful product/technology developed through DoP’s support in either of the following ways:
a. Through 5% % benefit sharing on net sale proceeds per year of the product starting from first sale of the product/technology till 10 years; or
b. Through 5% benefit sharing on net sale of the product till amount starting from first sale of the product/technology till the amount is equivalent to 100% of assistance received from DoP: or
c. In the form of equity (face value of shares equivalent to 100% of the assistance provided by DoP).
2 DoP would also seek payment in case there is transfer of intermittent technology, know-how, application to third party to further carry out commercialization with/ without further development by way of one-time transaction.
3 Payment of benefit sharing shall fall due beginning with the first sale of the product(s) and the liability to pay benefit sharing will terminate upon the first of any of the following two events to occur:
a. Payment of 5% % benefit sharing on net sale of the product for a period of 10 years.
b. Through 5%% benefit sharing on net sale of the product till amount is equivalent to 100% of assistance disbursed from DoP that was not returned as unutilized funds OR in the form of equity
c. in case of Foreclosure or Termination of Project.
data.checklist_info_d: Address , number & email id is availabe by referring to this link- https://pharmaceuticals.gov.in/contactus
